content.question: Part B ​​​The functions <math alttext="j"><mi>j</mi></math> and <math alttext="k"> <mi>k</mi> </math> are given by <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 10 open parentheses 8 x to the power of 5 close parentheses plus log subscript 10 open parentheses 2 x squared close parentheses minus 9 log subscript 10 x"> <mi>j</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>8</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>-</mo> <mn>9</mn> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mi>x</mi> </math> <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses fraction numerator 1 minus sin squared x over denominator sin x end fraction close parentheses sec x"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mfenced><mi>sec</mi><mi>x</mi></math>. (i) Rewrite <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single logarithm base <math alttext="10"><mn>10</mn></math> without negative exponents in any part of the expression. Your result should be of the form <math alttext="log subscript 10 open parentheses text expression end text close parentheses"><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mtext>expression</mtext></mfenced></math>. (ii) Rewrite <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single term involving <math alttext="tan x"><mi>tan</mi><mi>x</mi></math>.

frqParts.text: Part B ​​​The functions <math alttext="j"><mi>j</mi></math> and <math alttext="k"> <mi>k</mi> </math> are given by <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 10 open parentheses 8 x to the power of 5 close parentheses plus log subscript 10 open parentheses 2 x squared close parentheses minus 9 log subscript 10 x"> <mi>j</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>8</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>-</mo> <mn>9</mn> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>10</mn> </msub> <mi>x</mi> </math> <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses fraction numerator 1 minus sin squared x over denominator sin x end fraction close parentheses sec x"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mfenced><mi>sec</mi><mi>x</mi></math>. (i) Rewrite <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single logarithm base <math alttext="10"><mn>10</mn></math> without negative exponents in any part of the expression. Your result should be of the form <math alttext="log subscript 10 open parentheses text expression end text close parentheses"><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mtext>expression</mtext></mfenced></math>. (ii) Rewrite <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single term involving <math alttext="tan x"><mi>tan</mi><mi>x</mi></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
